[Music]
hi and welcome you listening to the x-22
report my name is Dave and this is
episode 1327 a and today's date is July
9th 2017 and the top of the episode is
the next economic crisis will crush the
working class jobs will be scarce now
before I get started I just want to make
an announcement I uploaded a new
interview with with Harley schlanger it
is on the x-22 report spotlight YouTube
channel or you can view the video on the
x-22 report comm site or the new
Sentinel site all you need to do is
scroll down a little bit on those sites
look over to your right hand side you'll
see the video and you can play it right
on the site or you can go to steam it
that is steam it calm and all you to do
is do a forward slash at x20 to report
it will bring you right to the video and
you can view it right on steam it let's
get into the economic collapse financial
news you know as we know this entire
system and I'm talking about the global
system when this system breaks apart and
comes down just like in 2008 but of
course this time it's going to be a lot
worse because they really didn't fix the
problems all they did was tape over them
pretend they didn't exist and they kept
us in this illusionary world making us
think that everything was fine but we've
been drilling through all the economic
data we've been looking at each sector
and we're noticing that a lot of the
things that are occurring right now are
very similar to 2008 and a lot of the
statistics that we're looking at are
much worse prior to 2008 when the entire
system came down now we know that this
is not just going to be isolated in the
United States we know there's going to
be many other countries like Canada
Australia throughout Europe that are
going to get hit this is going to be a
global event and we can see in Canada
well things are progressing into a
perfect storm type of scenario
especially in the housing market now
remember the United States went through
this before many other countries have
also and we can see that there is a
perfect storm that is brewing
in several Canadian housing markets and
there are extreme pricing bubbles there
is over-indebted consumers a major
tightening of mortgage rules and the
prospect of rising rates all of this put
together is a disaster now on the
regulatory front Canada's office of the
superintendent of financial institutions
is considering new rules that would
require lenders to effectively stress
test borrowers now from a practical
standpoint but a move would immediately
remove around what say 20 percent of the
average Canadians home buying power now
take that add the rising of mortgage
rates and the housing prices continually
moving up it's going to be a lot more
than just 20% and that throws those
individuals out of the housing market
and by doing this this is going to
create a problem in Canada going back to
2008 here in the United States we saw
almost the same exact thing where there
were rising rates they were locking down
on who was getting a mortgage and as
time went on the entire system started
to break down the same thing is going to
happen out in Canada it's going to
happen in Australia it's going to happen
throughout Europe and what we're seeing
right now that we might be at the point
which I think we are where it's
completely too late to stop what is
coming there are signs that the global
economy can't avoid an economic
apocalypse now let's look at some of
these signs we have a tightening of the
monetary policy so what does this mean
well it means that the cycle of global
monetary tightening well it has begun
and we can see that the market
expectations are now being set by
officials while at the Bank of Canada at
the Bank of England the Fed the EU it is
all happening all at once what's the
other signs we are seeing well we're
seeing in
converted and flattening yield curves in
May of 2017 the Chinese government bond
market well it recorded its first-ever
inverted yield curve also the US
government bond yield curve over the
past six months has significantly
flattened and there are many market
analysts out there saying that an
inverted US yield curve well what does
that mean that means we're heading into
a recession or were already in a
recession we are also seeing signs of
sovereign and corporate defaults
sovereign government and corporate
defaults and both developed and
developing economies are beginning to
emerge for example China has registered
in 2017 its highest level of corporate
defaults in the first quarter of this
year delinquencies and charge-offs in
the United States soared to 1.4 billion
in the first quarter of 2017 the highest
recorded level since the first quarter
of 2011 we are also seeing falling
confidence and credit downgrades in May
of 2017 six major Canadian banks were
downgraded by Moody's Investor service
why concerns over the rise over soaring
Canadian household debt and housing
prices which leaves the lenders
vulnerable to losses
Moody's also downgraded China's
sovereign debt in May for the first time
since 1989 and has warned of further
downgrades if further reforms are not
enacted we're also saying that SP is
downgraded 23 small to medium Australian
financial institutions as the risk of
falling property prices increases and
potential financial losses start to
increase in June Moody's downgraded 12
Australian Australian banks including
Australia's four major banks we're also
seeing a major credit crisis headed our
way where we know that the credit
impulse which UBS reported on well that
is in the negative territory and with
the interview that I just did with Jason
Burak he was citing that the
credit cycle well it is coming to an end
now we also have something very
interesting happening here significant
growth in the value of crypto currencies
now a lot of people look at this and say
I have what's the big deal about that
who cares about Bitcoin who cares about
all of this cryptocurrency it makes no
sense whatsoever and what does it have
to do with the economy anyhow well think
about what's been happening right now in
the past five months the cryptocurrency
industry well they have experienced
tremendous growth in market
capitalization why why has it seen such
growth well remember a lot of these
investors they're receiving no interest
in the banks whatsoever many people are
very nervous about the fiat currency and
investors are seeking to escape the
formal banking and financial system and
they're looking for a place to put their
currency so they've turned to crypto
currencies now we can see this out in
Japan where the Japanese businesses and
citizens have been pouring billions into
Bitcoin and we need to remember out in
Japan they have negative interest rates
and people are not sure of the economy
they're trying to escape all the
regulations they're trying to escape the
control of the central bank we also see
this in China we see this in a lot of
the emerging markets and it's starting
to grow here in the US yes it is quite
small right now but we can see the big
players they are getting into the crypto
currency for a reason and we're seeing a
lot of the big players starting to do
this right now and that is a sure sign
that something is about to change and
change drastically because what we're
seeing is that people are losing faith
in the current system and yes we are at
the beginning stages of this not many
people know about crypto currencies if
you ask them they might have heard
something about it but they have no clue
what it is and normally what happens in
the beginning stages
all the insiders they get in first then
it moves down to the next level the next
level and before you know it the
everyday person is trying to get in but
all those people who got in in the
beginning they met out very very well
and all those individuals who waited
because they couldn't believe where they
weren't sure or they didn't know
anything about it they're left out in
the dark it's the same thing with the
stock market the housing market the
insiders realized and they know from
being insiders that they've reached the
bubble the height of the bubble they
start getting out of the market getting
out of the housing market and then
they're celled off to sold off to retail
investors retail speculators who say hey
this is the perfect time to get in and
that's what I'm going to do and then all
of a sudden the entire system comes
crashing down though all those people
are left with losing assets they lose
all their money but the insiders they
made it out I remember in the beginning
of the internet craze where there were
many many individuals that knew what was
happening and they were buying up as
many domain names as they possibly could
they owned them and it could be for a
major corporation it could be for you
know so a small business but they took
those names and then they sold them off
later on making millions of dollars
because they understood that everyone
wanted to have an online presence
eventually maybe not in the beginning
when we had AOL or if anyone remembers
prodigy maybe not at that point but they
knew it was coming so they started to
purchase as many of the domain names as
possible the same thing is happening
right now
these insiders these people who know
they realize what is coming and this is
why they're making the move right now
and we're seeing it happen not just here
in United States but all over the world
actually it's happening first all over
the world and a little bit here in the
United States because we're kept in the
dark I say most of the people who are
still sleeping thinking that the dollar
is the supreme currency and that is
about to change now when this next
economic crisis calm
it is going to be very difficult for
many individuals and the reason why I'm
saying this and this is coming from Wolf
Wolf Richter he wrote an article about
this why the next recession will be a
doozy for consumers and when you really
think about it you could understand why
this is going to be a problem now
remember when we had other recessions
they recovered jobs were created and the
economy got better but something changed
since 2000 and it could be seen in the
employment population ratio which tracks
people over 16 years of age who have
jobs as defined by the BLS from 1960
until 2000 the ratio fell during the
recessions but then during the recovery
basically regained all the lost ground
plus some ratcheting up to new records
after each recession some of this had to
do with women entering the workforce in
large numbers now the ratio peak in
April of 2000 was at 64.7% a new pattern
was developed as before the ratio drops
before the official recession begins and
keeps dropping until after the recession
has ended but when employment recovers
the ratio picks up only slowly
recovering only a fraction of the ground
loss before the next recession hits this
has happened over the last two
recessions now the ratio plunged from
sixty three point four percent to fifty
eight point two percent in November of
2010 and again in June and July of 2011
it plunged five point two percentage
points in four and a half years now
during that time non-farm payrolls
plunged by eight point seven million
jobs over the seven plus years of the
jobs recovery the economy added sixteen
point seven million jobs 146 point four
million non-farm payrolls as defined by
the BLS and we know a lot of these jobs
are part-time but the employment
population ratio
only needed to 60% it gave it regained
only 1.9 percentage points after
plunging 5.2 percentage points in other
words after seven plus years of this
incredible jobs recovery it has regained
less than one-third of what it had lost
and now the Fed is preparing for the
next recession what happens during the
next recession well one thing we know
from the last two recessions during the
next employment downturn the employment
population ratio will get crushed from a
much lower base than during the prior
recessions and one thing we know for
sure the next recession will be even
tougher on people who want to work and
if these people aren't working then
they're not going out shopping they're
not going out shopping that means retail
business online brick-and-mortar doesn't
make a difference will be suffering
think about what happened after the
Great Recession of 2008 you know that
labor participation rate why is it the
lowest we've ever seen it because people
could not find jobs it's at something
like 62 or 64 percent and they're saying
well these people they don't want to
work they're falling off
they haven't been on an interview in
four weeks so we just don't count them
anymore what do you think is going to
happen during the next downturn this
number is going to be a complete
disaster I mean what's going to be their
explanation there'll be no retail stores
left food and services that that's
continually declining where all these
jobs going to come from manufacturing
there are no manufacturing jobs here
they're leaving still so this next
downturn is going to be a bigger
disaster than what we saw in 2008 and
this recovery of jobs there's going to
be done it's going to be a very very
tough
read of time and this is why we need to
be prepared because when this time hits
it's not like oh the recession came it's
now two or three months let me go get
another job you're not going to find
that retail part-time job you're not
going to find that foodservice job
there's going to be double the amount of
people that are out of work corporations
because the stock market and the tax
receipt revenues coming into the
corporations they're really non-existent
everything that you see in the stock
market that's an illusion that's going
to come down and crash completely and
even if they keep it propped up
companies they still won't be able to

there's nothing they can do about
